properties.name: Dallas, Texas
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I was only here for a layover when I came home from Frankfurt, Germany in 2004. I do have family here. But, I have never had the chance to visit them here.

properties.name: Dresden, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88My last week in Europe, Katharina\'s family took me to Dresden. It was the place that affected me most. I actually saw numerous places throughout the city that were still being reconstructed from when the U.S. bombed the &%0 out of it in WWII. One place in particular, die Fraunkirche, completely collapsed after we bombed Dresden, and after they cleared the rubble they salvaged all the sandstone they could and rebuilt with new sandstone. So, when you see a picture of it, or in person there are two colors of sandstone. Old and new. I call it the polk-a-dot church. Last year, they finished the completion of the rebuilding of it. It has taken them that long to rebuild something it took seconds to destroy. It made me think about the correlation between life changing decisions and time. I would gladly go back to see the reopening of the "women church" and to see how the citizens\' reaction to something so near to their hearts.

properties.name: Ensenada, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I went here in 1998 and in 2002. I didn\'t like it the first time, but the second time I did. I liked the shopping and the food. In \'98 we went down there for the day, but in \'02 we spent the day there because my family was on a cruise for my 8th grade promotion. If I go down to Mexico again, it will be somewhere to vacation, and not to shop for the day.

properties.name: Frankfurt, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I flew out of Frankfurt to go home to the United States after my summer trip in 2004.

properties.name: Good Ole San Fran
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I have been here twice. Enjoyed the trollies, the shopping, the scenery. It\'s a place of culture and chocolate...:P

properties.name: Grand Canyon National Park
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88 I\'ve also been here twice, and loved it both times. I have never hiked to the bottom, but the scenery is beautiful. I have also whitewater rafted the Colorado River. It\'s best to go in March or April, when there is still snow and it\'s cold; but not too cold. I have a handmade piece of Native American turquoise jewelry from here. I would love to go back.

properties.name: Grand Teton National Park
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88 The only thing I have to say is that it is breathtaking. Beautifully breathtaking... The Tetons are a perfect example of pure nature. I\'m not that outdoor-sy, and I love the Tetons...love.

properties.name: Graz, the summer of 2004
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I came here after staying in Vienna. There was so much culture to see and so much to experience. Their city hall looks like a cathedral, and their post offices are not just a boxs on corners. The flat I stayed in was across the street from a brick cathedral. We swam in a lake just outside the city. There was a slower pace. And it was quieter, than I ever thought possible in a huge city. I bought 3 drawings from a street artist. I drank warm beer and loved the smell of schnitzel everywhere I went. Everyday there is an open market to buy anything from flowers to fresh meat to fabric. The city\'s landmark is called the "Clock Tower". You can see it from all over Graz. I only wish I spoke the language better, so I could get a better grasp on their culture. I loved it here.

properties.name: Hawaii 1995
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I went to Hawaii in 1995 and I still remember it. We stayed on Maui. We went in a submarine and saw a bunch of tropical fish; we went scubadiving and took a helicopter ride over sugarcane fields. We went to a lu\'au (with a pig in a pit) and got to pet parrots from a street vendor (I took a picture with 6 macaws all over me; it was awesome!). I remember taking a picture next to a hibiscus flower the size of my head. I loved that trip.

properties.name: Heathrow Airport
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I was only here a few hours. But I did get a stamp in my passport. It rained, and I couldn\'t understand people\'s accents. I felt really bad asking people to repeat things. Hopefully next time I am there I will get to spend more time in the city and get to know the people even more. :)

properties.name: Jackson, Wyoming
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88This is a great little city (quite expensive) to spend the night in if you are passing through to see Yellowstone National Park. We camped for three nights here. We also whitewater rafted here. I would gladly go back.

properties.name: Kansas City, Missouri
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88This was our layover location both going to New York and coming back from Washington, D.C. in the summer of 2006. It was very flat. And, there was something there, at the airport that I had never scene before; a tornado shelter.

properties.name: Munich, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88This was a transitional city. After the train stopped here, I was met by my other family friend, Katharina. We then went to the southwest part of Germany and stayed with one of her family friends. They lived in a castle. I got the grand tour, over thirty rooms. One boasting a skinned grizzly bear and a zebra, among other animals. There was also a room for drinking beer, where the family friend of Katharina challenged me to a shot. But not just any shot...80% proof to be exact. I thought I was going to die. It was off to the "Cat\'s Hut" after this...

properties.name: My new home...
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88Last summer I came to visit here, and fell in love with the campus. Of course, I now go here. I\'ve made many friends and love college life.

properties.name: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I went here when I was in grade school to visit family. It was lush, and green, but very humid and rainy. The smell of homemade rhubarb pie was always in the house I stayed in. I would love to go back.

properties.name: Salzburg, Austria
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I only spent one night here. We saw Mozart\'s house. And we stayed in a youth hostel. I took the train from Salzburg to Munich, Germany.

properties.name: Seattle, Washington
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I have family that lives here. It\'s nice to go in the summer and can pickles. It\'s beautiful. I love it there. Everything is always green...:)

properties.name: The Big Apple
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88For my graduation trip, my parents took me to New York City. We flew into La Guardia and were immediately shocked at the driving tendencies of the cabbies. All we could do was hang on for dear life. :P We got to our hotel, exhausted. Over the next 3 days we had lunch at Tavern on the Green, saw Central Park, the Dakota Apartments (where John Lennon was killed), shopping on 5th Avenue, Wall Street (men walking around with machine guns wasn\'t exactly what we were expecting), Ground Zero (it was touching to see the timeline of that day, what happened in detail; however, there were a few men standing around selling propaganda pamphlets from September 11), The Empire State Building, The Metropolitan Museum, The Statue of Liberty (as I recall, women were not allowed at the dedication of it in 1886; look how far we\'ve come), Ellis Island (which was very moving because of all the people who passed through it, trying to make a life for themselves in America; to fulfill their American Dream), saw Phantom of the Opera on Broadway (amazing!), Timesquare, Hell\'s Kitchen, and the U.N. (the thing I loved about the U.N. was that when we walked in, there are about 100 pictures of elderly people from all around the country (most of them dead) and it told a little snip-it of their life next to each of their pictures; I remember this one lady. She lived to be over 100 and she had something like 95 great-grand children. It was really awesome to see all of the ancestors that made this country what it is; "average" people, not looking for fortune and fame; just looking to survive). I enjoyed my stay in New York immensely, and I would love to visit again someday; possibly, even live there.

properties.name: The City of Lost Wages
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I\'ve only been here twice. Would love to go again. I\'ve stayed at Excalabur and Luxor. I do not think I would want to live here. It\'s too hot. But a nice place to visit.

properties.name: Vancouver, Canada
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I went here on August 31, 1997 on a day trip with my family from Seattle. We came home at midnight and we turned on the news to find that Princess Di had been killed in a car crash. I find it weird that I remember that. I should go back. I don\'t remember it all that well.

properties.name: Vienna, the summer of 2004
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I landed here from Heathrow. My family friend, Bettina, met me and we drove to her flat. I was exhausted but somehow I managed to get up the next morning without feeling tired. We walked the city for 15 hours. I bought tons of things from the street market they have on weekends, with vendors trying to sell me raw meat and olives. We finally stopped in a park and took a nap, where I fell in love with this nearby, rundown building. Its walls were the color of ash and it looked neglected and loved at the same time. We had drinks at this little cafe nearby and talked for 4 hours about everything and nothing. That day we also went to castle where the Austrian Monarchs used to live, when Austria was a monarchy. This was also breathtaking. We shopped on something similar to 5th Avenue in New York. We stayed there 3 days and I can honestly say, this is where I belong. I loved everything I saw and tasted, everything I heard and smelled. There has never been a day since I took that vacation that I haven\'t thought about buying a one-way ticket, and never looking back.

properties.name: Washington, D.C. 2006
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88After New York, we took a train to Washington, D.C. We were there over the 4th of July. We went to the Library of Congress, The Smithsonian (no National Archives though; they flooded the week before we went). We took a day cruise to Mount Vernon, Virginia and toured George Washington\'s home and land. We also saw The Washington Monument, The WWII, Vietnam, FDR, Lincoln, Jefferson Memorials. We saw the Holocaust Museum (very eye-opening) and Arlington National Cemetery (we saw JFK and Jacky Kennedy Onasis\'s graves in addition to the changing of the guard). When we flew out of Ronald Reagan Airport I actually saw the changing of the guard from the air. It was something I will always remember. I loved Washington, D.C. but I hated the weather. Yuck!

properties.name: Where I lived for the majority of my childhood and young adulthood
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I moved to Temecula when I was barely 6. Being an only child, making friends came easily. I am still great friends with someone I met in 1st grade. Her name is Emily. She now attends SDSU. We lived in two houses in Temecula. This is where I went to school and had my first job at a Hallmark store. This place, considered boring by some, is in reality not all that monotonous. Yes, I consider it to be "Yuppi Town" but that doesn\'t mean it\'s not a part of me. After I received my Redlands acceptance letter, I realized I would have to start a new chapter in life. But, I shall never forget Temecula...the place that I have grown the most, the place I still call "home".

properties.name: Where I spent most of my childhood...
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88I moved to Temecula when I was barely 6. My dad changed jobs, and we ended up in Temecula. It had a population of 32,000 then. Now, it\'s at almost 100,000. Being an only child, making friends came easily. I am still great friends with someone I met in 1st grade. Her name is Emily. She now attends SDSU. We lived in two houses in Temecula. This is where I went to school and had my first job at a Hallmark store. This place, considered boring by some, is in reality not all that monotonous. Yes, I consider it to be "Yuppi Town" but that doesn\'t mean it\'s not a part of me. After I received my Redlands acceptance letter, I realized I would have to start a new chapter in life. But, I shall never forget Temecula...the place that I have grown the most, the place I still call "home".

properties.name: Where I was born...
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88This is where I made my humble entrance into the world on June 20, 1988. I was 7 lbs. 6oz. and 20 inches long and one month early. I am the only child that my parents have. After 30 years of marriage, they have taught me more about life than anyone else. So, this is where I began...

properties.name: Yellowstone National Park '98 and '05
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88 I\'ve been here twice. Both times, it was incredibly amazing. From mudpots to geysers, to deer and bison (I can\'t forget the mama moose and its baby!), it was non-stop fun, excitement and beauty. I have yet to see a bear though. I really want to see a bear. Maybe it will happen in the following trips; I only hope!

properties.name: Yosemite National Park 2002
properties.description: Posted by Natlip88 I went here after 8th grade promotion. We went whitewater rafting. It was great fun, but there was hardly any wildlife compared to Yellowstone National Park. Beautiful!
